# Draft:2028 presidential candidates in the United States

Republicans
Ted Cruz (Texas Senator) (2013-?)
Ron DeSantis (Governor Of Florida) (2019-?)
Tulsi Gabbard (Director of National Intelligence) (2025-?)
Nikki Haley (Ambassador to the United Nations) (2017-2018)
Brian Kemp (Governor Of Georgia) (2019-?)
Kristi Noem (United States Secretary of Homeland Security) (2025-?)
Mike Pence (Vice President) (2017-2021)
Vivek Ramaswamy (Entrepreneur)
Marco Rubio (Secretary Of State) (2025-?)
Sarah Huckabee Sanders (Governor Of Arkansas) (2023-?)
Tim Scott (South Carolina Senator) (2013-?)
Elise Stefanik (Ambassador of the United States to the United Nations Nominee)
Donald Trump Jr (First Son) (2017-2021 2025-?)
JD Vance (Vice President) (2025-?)
Glenn Youngkin (Governor Of Virginia) (2022-?)
Democrats
Andy Beshear (Governor Of Kentucky) (2019-?)
Joe Biden (President) (2021-2025)
Cory Brooker (New Jersey Senator) (2013-?)
Nick Brown (Attorney General Of Washington (2025-?)
Pete Buttigieg (Secretary Of Transportation) (2021-2025)
Roy Cooper (Governor Of North Carolina) (2017-2025)
Rahm Emmanuel (Ambassador To Japan) (2022-2025)
Ruben Gallego (Arizona Senator) (2025-?)
Kamala Harris (Vice President) (2021-2025)
Dwayne Johnson (Actor)
Ro Khanna (Representative From California 17th District) (2017-?)
Amy Klobuchar (Minnesota Senator) (2007-?)
Chris Murphy (Connecticut Senator) (2013-?)
Gavin Newsom (Governor Of California) (2019-?)
Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez (Representative From New York 14th District)
Jon Ossoff (Georgia Senator) (2021-?)
Dean Phillips (Representative From Minnesota 3rd District) (2019-2025)
Jared Polis (Governor Of Colorado) (2019-?)
JB Pritzker (Governor Of Illinois) (2019-?)
Gina Raimondo (Secretary of Commerce) (2021-2025)
Josh Shapiro (Governor Of Pennsylvania) (2023-?)
Tim Walz (Governor Of Minnesota) (2019-?)
Raphael Warncock (Georgia Senator) (2021-?)
Gretchen Whitmer (Governor Of Michigan) (2019-?)
Libertarian
Chase Oliver (Sales Account Executive)
Jo Jorgenson (Academic)
Independent
Robert F Kennedy Jr (Secretary of Health and Human Services) (2025-?)
Green
Jill Stein (Member of the Lexington Town Meeting from the 2nd Precinct) (2005-2010)
Cynthia McKinney (Representative From Georgia 3rd District) (1997-2003)
